replies.bodyText: @Nurkambay probably, if you pull changes from dev branch, these would be unused we can get rid of them. Apart from the newly introduced. For which you would have to introduce your key in messages_en.properties file and use.

timeline.bodyText: The name is already in UpperCase. It's done in visitParagraphNameUsage method.
timeline.author: grianbrcom
grianbrcom

replies.bodyText: In that case there will be 2 diagnostic errors. One of them will be that counts for usages and declarations do not match. To avoid this I did not use {#PRINT-DATA}
replies.author: Nurkambay

timeline.message:
improvement: Improve Semantic Analysis for Paragraphs #526

improvement: Improve Semantic Analysis for Paragraphs #526

timeline.author: temanbrcom

timeline.bodyText: Please, provide a description of what do you check here and what is the expected behavior
timeline.author: temanbrcom
temanbrcom

timeline.bodyText: Looks ok for me, but we should make sure with Scott what is the expected error message from the COBOL programmer point of view. It may be changed later on.
timeline.author: temanbrcom
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -17,6 +17,7 @@ CobolVisitor.declarativeSameMsg=The following token cannot be on the same line a
 CobolVisitor.invalidDefMsg=Invalid definition for: %s
 CobolVisitor.misspelledWord=A misspelled word, maybe you want to put %s
 CobolVisitor.progIDIssueMsg=There is an issue with PROGRAM-ID paragraph
+CobolVisitor.paragraphNotDefined=The following paragraph is not defined: %s

timeline.bodyText: Ok, will work for now. We will change the paragraph context to accept localities later on, altogether with the same late check for variables.
timeline.author: temanbrcom

replies.bodyText: Yep. Better to use Locality instead of Location internally and only for publishing to the client convert map values to Location.
replies.author: Nurkambay

timeline.bodyText: A section is not a paragraph, it should not be consumed here
timeline.author: temanbrcom
